meanings.definition: To remove the breeches or pants from someone.
meanings.sent1: Dad was unbreeching the little boy after he played in the mud.
meanings.sent2: She quickly unbreeched herself before jumping into the pool.
meanings.sent3: The magician unbreeched the volunteer, revealing colorful shorts underneath.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sky seemed to unbreech its vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar unbreeched itself from the cocoon, emerging as a beautiful butterfly.

meanings.definition: The act of taking off or removing breeches or pants.
meanings.sent1: The unbreeching of the knight before battle was a ceremonial tradition.
meanings.sent2: After the race, the jockey's unbreeching was done swiftly by the stable hands.
meanings.sent3: The unbreeching of the clown during the show caused laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unbreeching of the old building revealed hidden architectural details.
meanings.sent5: The unbreeching of the ship's sails signaled the start of the voyage.
